snippet.title: Defender (1994 C64 game from Magna Media/64'er)
snippet.description:
Despite it's name, this is NOT a clone of Defender, but more of a Space Invaders (or galaxian) Variant. Has some innovative features, such as double fire, speedy fire, and powerups to remove or even give you a barrier to protect yourself (ala space invaders, but your wall is determined more by powerups than by enemy fire, although the enemy fire can also remove pieces as well) Coded by Jan Zimmerman (who also coded a really good H.E.R.O. clone called Dark Caves) as well Flummi's World. Most of his games are done by companies like Markt & Technik, CP Verlag, etc.

The gameplay is pretty fun, albeit slightly repetitive. I give this game a 7/10

A variation of Space Invaders (not Defender)  that was release by Magna Media/64'er in 1994, and coded by Jan Zimmerman. It differs in Space Invaders in several ways, one of which is power-ups. During the game large colored balls falls from the sky and land on the ground (if they don't land on you first) These balls represent several power-ups

red ball =  higher shot frequency
violet ball = double shot power
green ball = super shot
blue ball = slower energy-downcounter
orange ball = destroys all aliens currently on the screen
brown ball = builds up wall/barrier
light-blue ball = faster shot
light-red ball = takes away wall
